comments:
This is an "error path" type scenario: have a C/C++ project and closed it!
Select the closed project and then launch a C/C++ application from the debug 
launchers menu.
When you select "Finish" in the wizard, you get the internal error, see below 
contents of the .log file.

This scenario probably needs to be prevented earlier on, in the launcher
(checking for project status, if closed, abort), but it shows a potential 
problem in other scenarios.
Also the solution to this, might be part of how to do the prevention in the 
launcher.  I.e. some return code which the launcher can use.
===============================================================================

I've added a null check for the project element.   That prevents the exception.

There is still an issue that we will have to deal with though.  After the 
project has been closed, you can still relaunch the debugger.  We should look 
into removing the launch object from the process view after a project has been 
closed.
